alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued February 19 at 7:14PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Northwest Avalanche Center. ...The Northwest Avalanche Center in Seattle has issued an Avalanche Warning... * WHAT...High avalanche danger will develop in the warning area at all elevations. * WHERE...Stevens and Snoqualmie Passes and the West Slopes of the central Cascades including avalanche terrain around the Mt Loop Highway. * WHEN...In effect 6pm Sunday through 6 pm PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow and strong winds at upper elevations and rain at lower elevations will lead to increasing avalanche danger Sunday night and Monday. High avalanche danger will likely continue into Monday night for the same areas. High avalanche danger may exist outside the warning areas - check your local forecast for details. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions will develop over the next 24 hours. Travel in avalanche terrain in not recommended. Avoid any area where avalanches can start, run or stop. Consult https://www.nwac.us/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County
